task_definition_name: Mifos Self Service Android - Fix EditText Errors On SignUp Screen

text:
Before pressing SignUp button,

When the user makes it's first walkthrough signup fields, then error message should be only changed, when focus changes and that previous field is not correct. Now, if user goes back to that fields live update validation should work.

After pressing SignUp, live update for all will be enabled.
task_definition_name: Mifos Self Service Android - Fix EditText Errors On SignUp Screen

text:
You're right if we are talking about the live update validation AFTER user clicked the register button -  all of the inputs are validated then and, as you said, there's no reason to separate methods since we can check all of them just because user can change only one of the inputs at the same time. 

But don't we want to get a live update even if no registration button was clicked before? How can we achieve that then? 

With one single validation method for all inputs, when user type anything in one of them, all of the validators will check every input and show error message if needed - even if they were not previously focused.

I'm sorry for these kind of questions, but I'm not sure if I understand the effect which we want to achieve.
task_definition_name: Mifos Self Service Android - Fix EditText Errors On SignUp Screen

text: No split of condition is required. At a time user can make change to only one EditText. So, only one section of if-else will be trigger. So, no separation is required.
task_definition_name: Mifos Self Service Android - Fix EditText Errors On SignUp Screen

text:
Great Job
Let's make the UI/UX more cleaner and better.

Now when the user is focussed the the relevant EditText.
Unlike, Paypal we have multiple check on the EditText fields. Add a textwatcher.

So that when user fills `username` after pressing the button error message should be removed, when 6 characters are added. And if he/she removes a changes the message should be popped.

This will give the user, a perfect experience.

text:

task_definition_name: Mifos Self Service Android - Fix EditText Errors On SignUp Screen

text:
I have some ideas which could improve UX. 

Using PayPal made me notice that they're using a function to automatically scroll to first of invalid inputs (if exists) when user clicks on register button. It's really useful because the invalid input might be not visible to user which could make him dismayed. I could implement that as a part of this task. What do you think about this idea?

Second idea is a live update feature which I've already implemented at the begging, but get rid of that since you've said we will be refactoring validation into separate class, so I've also squashed every validation method into one - areFieldsValidated(). I would love to add this feature when we will create separated class for validation. So I would say it's on my TODO list.

text:
Hi letelete,
I have seen that you are adding a new commit everytime you make some changes. This is the a correct way to maintain a good commit history. Instead, of making new commit, use `git commit --amend` to make the those changes to the latest commit. 
I have added more changes that you need to make, you can work on them.
